intro: Sitanion × insulare, commonly known as the island sitanion, is a hybrid plant native to the Philippines. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sitanion × insulare is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
